title: 'Everyone follows fashion' - is Premier League better now than 20 years ago?
description: In his BBC Sport column, ex-Premier League boss Tony Pulis looks at what has changed in the Premier League in the past couple of decades and whether it is for the better, from a manager's perspective.

title: Guehi scores late header to secure Crystal Palace win over Fulham
description: Crystal Palace captain Marc Guehi scores a late header for a 2-1 win against Fulham which moves them into the top four in the Premier League.

title: Man United star Amad in contention for top Premier League award
description: Manchester United forward Amad’s goal during last month’s 2-2 draw with Nottingham Forest has been shortlisted for the Premier League’s Goal of the Month award.Amad rescues United against Forest...

title: 'Some say I've found my level' - how Hughes regained spark at Carlisle
description: As Carlisle United prepare for Sunday's FA Cup tie at Blackpool, Mark Hughes opens up on managing in non-league after taking charge of 466 Premier League games.

title: Are Aston Villa in title hunt - and should Arsenal start to worry?
description: Unai Emery continues to deny Aston Villa are in the Premier League title race but Arsenal now look vulnerable.

title: 'One of the magic nights at Elland Road' - Leeds' week of hope
description: Leeds United's daunting week in the Premier League was expected to condemn them to the Championship, but it turned into their "week of hope".

title: Newcastle avoid late scare to beat 10-man Burnley
description: Bruno Guimaraes scores direct from a corner as Newcastle beat Burnley 2-1 at St. James' Park in the Premier League.

title: Simons scores first Premier League goal as Spurs beat Brentford
description: Thomas Frank gets a much-needed victory as Tottenham beat his former club Brentford 2-0, with Xavi Simons scoring his first Premier League goal.

title: Man City beat Sunderland to narrow gap at top
description: Manchester City beat Sunderland 3-0 to move within two points of leaders Arsenal in the Premier League.

title: Amorim defends his use of midfielder Mainoo
description: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim defends his failure to start any academy player in the Premier League this season and repeated his reasons for not giving Kobbie Mainoo an opportunity.

title: Sutton's predictions v DJ and producer Paige Tomlinson
description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on DJ Paige Tomlinson - and AI - with his predictions for this weekend's Premier League fixtures.

title: Match of the Day
description: Highlights from nine Premier League matches across a busy midweek schedule.

title: Hislop being treated for aggressive prostate cancer
description: Former Premier League goalkeeper Shaka Hislop says he has an aggressive form of prostate cancer, and urges men of Caribbean heritage to get tested for the disease.

title: Who has the most and least gruelling December among Premier League teams?
description: Which team has to play three matches, in three competitions, in six days later this month? And which Premier League team has the least exhausting December schedule? BBC Sport takes a look.

title: Who has made Troy's Premier League team of the week?
description: After every round of Premier League matches this season Troy Deeney gives us his team of the week. Do you agree with his choices?

title: Man Utd halted as Magassa gets first West Ham goal
description: Watch Premier League highlights as Manchester United are held at home by West Ham, with Soungoutou Magassa scoring his first Hammers goal.

title: Leeds win over Chelsea 'well deserved' - Farke
description: Leeds manager Daniel Farke says his players deserved their win against Chelsea, after beating the Blues 3-1 at Elland Road to climb out of the Premier League relegation zone.

title: 'His voice was gone' - how 'demanding' Emery inspired Villa comeback
description: Aston Villa were in the relegation zone after five games but are now third in the Premier League with 'demanding' Unai Emery having played a key part in the turnaround.

title: Arteta praises 'mature' Arsenal performance in win over Brentford
description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta says his side's performance in their 2-0 win over Brentford in the Premier League was "mature".

title: Munoz scores as Palace edge past Burnley for win
description: Daniel Munoz scores the only goal as Crystal Palace climb to fifth in the Premier League with victory against Burnley.

title: Forest claim three points as Wolves' winless run continues
description: Igor Jesus' first Premier League goal condemns winless Wolves to another defeat as Nottingham Forest edge a poor game at Molineux.

title: Arsenal extend unbeaten run with victory over Brentford
description: Mikel Merino and Bukayo Saka score as Arsenal beat Brentford to restore their five-point lead at the top of the Premier League table.

title: Leeds stun Chelsea to end four-game losing streak
description: Struggling Leeds end a four-game losing run to dent Chelsea's Premier League title charge with a stunning 3-1 win at Elland Road.

title: Ex-England player arrested on suspicion of attempted rape
description: A former England and Premier League footballer has been arrested at Stansted Airport on suspicion of attempted rape.

title: How Haaland set Premier League's 100-goal record
description: Erling Haaland smashed Alan Shearer's record of reaching 100 Premier League goals the quickest in Manchester City's thrilling 5-4 win at Fulham.

title: Man City hold off incredible Fulham fightback as Haaland passes milestone
description: Erling Haaland becomes the quickest player to reach 100 goals in Premier League history as Manchester City ramp up pressure on leaders Arsenal by fending off Fulham's impressive fightback in a nine-goal thriller.

title: Eleven and hell - the cost of Newcastle's dropped points
description: Newcastle United have dropped more points from winning positions than any other side in the Premier League this season - the tally now stands at 11 after Tuesday's 2-2 draw with Tottenham.

title: Sutton's predictions v Tailenders host Felix White
description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on Felix White - and AI - with his predictions for the midweek Premier League fixtures.

title: Maresca praises 'outstanding' Chelsea response after Caicedo red card
description: Manager Enzo Maresca praises Chelsea's "outstanding" response to claim a 1-1 Premier League draw against leaders Arsenal at Stamford Bridge after midfielder Moises Caicedo was sent off in the first half.

title: Brighton beat Nottingham Forest to go fifth in the table
description: Brighton beat Nottingham Forest 2-0 with goals from Maxim De Cuyper and Stefanos Tzimas to go fifth in the Premier League table.

title: How 'sensational' James helped Chelsea stop Arsenal
description: Match of the Day pundit Micah Richards analyses how Reece James produced a "sensational" midfield performance to help 10-man Chelsea hold Premier League leaders Arsenal to a 1-1 draw at Stamford Bridge.

title: Kamara stunner wins derby for Villa over Wolves
description: Boubacar Kamara scores a stunning goal to fire Aston Villa to third in the Premier League after a gritty 1-0 derby win over Wolves at Villa Park.

title: How Villa have relied on record number of long-range goals
description: Aston Villa have scored a higher percentage of their goals from outside the box than any side in Premier League history.

title: Liverpool plan Camavinga bid - Monday's gossip
description: Premier League champions Liverpool to bid for Real Madrid midfielder Eduardo Camavinga, Everton snub offers for winger Iliman Ndiaye, while Manchester City consider move for Bournemouth forward Antoine Semenyo, plus more.

title: Match-winner Mount's quality 'never in doubt'
description: Mason Mount scores Manchester United's winner at Crystal Palace and completes his first 90 minutes for the visitors in the Premier League.

title: Zirkzee and Mount help Man Utd secure comeback victory at Palace
description: Joshua Zirkzee breaks his 12-month Premier League goal drought before Mason Mount fires in from a well worked free-kick as Manchester United secure a second-half comeback victory against Crystal Palace.

title: Liverpool put end to losing run with win against West Ham
description: Alexander Isak scores his first Premier League goal for Liverpool as Arne Slot's side end their losing run with a 2-0 win away at West Ham.

title: Who has made Troy's Premier League team of the week?
description: After every round of Premier League matches this season, Troy Deeney gives us his team of the week. Do you agree with his choices?

title: 10-man Chelsea hold Arsenal to draw in feisty London derby
description: Chelsea produce a defiant performance to hold Premier League leaders Arsenal to a 1-1 draw at Stamford Bridge after going down to 10 men following Moises Caicedo's first-half dismissal.

title: 'Riding a wave' - Sunderland extend unbeaten home run
description: Sunderland's 'fabulous' form at Stadium of Light propels them up to fourth in the Premier League table.

title: 'Frustrated' Foden 'got Man City out of jail'
description: Phil Foden says he wanted "to prove to myself that I can still score goals" after his double helps Manchester City edge Leeds United to move second in the Premier League.

title: Man City 'bend rules' to deny Leeds - Farke
description: Daniel Farke says Manchester City were able to "bend the rules" to deny his Leeds team a precious Premier League point on Saturday at the Etihad Stadium.

title: Thiago scores twice as Brentford beat Burnley
description: Late goals from Igor Thiago and Dango Ouattara lead Brentford to a 3-1 victory against Burnley to move the Bees up to eighth in the Premier League table.

title: Fulham make blistering start to beat Spurs & increase pressure on Frank
description: Fulham score two goals in the opening six minutes to secure a 2-1 victory at Tottenham and inflict a fourth home defeat in seven Premier League games this season for Thomas Frank's side.

title: Newcastle defeat Everton for first league away win
description: Malick Thiaw scores twice to help Newcastle United beat Everton 4-1 and claim their first away win of the season in the premier league.

title: Sutton's predictions v rapper Kofi Stone
description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on rapper Kofi Stone - and AI - with his predictions for this weekend's Premier League fixtures.

title: 10 wins from 11 - the Premier League 'domination' of La Liga
description: BBC Sport examines the reasons behind a period of dominance by Premier League teams over their La Liga rivals.

title: Liverpool's 'lack of intensity' exposed by PSV
description: Champions League analyst Stephen Warnock says that a "lack of intensity" from Liverpool is made it easy for PSV to create opportunities and beat the Premier League champions 4-1 at Anfield.

title: Have Premier League's most expensive signings been successful?
description: Which of the Premier League's most expensive signings can be considered a success, or a failure, relative to their achievements?

title: Why VAR offside images are not always what they seem
description: When the Premier League rolled out semi-automated offside technology we thought we would lose the rows about offside.

title: Premier League clubs urged to freeze ticket prices
description: More than 100 fan groups urge Premier League clubs to freeze home ticket prices for the next two seasons.

title: What is going on with offside, and can it be fixed?
description: After more controversy with subjective offside in the Premier League this weekend, can anything be done to change it?

title: Guardiola 'embarrassed and ashamed' after cameraman incident
description: Pep Guardiola says he is sorry for confronting a cameraman following Manchester City's Premier League defeat at Newcastle on Saturday.

title: Who has made Troy's Premier League team of the week?
description: After every round of Premier League matches this season, Troy Deeney gives us his team of the week. Do you agree with his choices?

title: Ten-man Everton stun Man Utd after Gueye sees red
description: after Idrissa Gueye is sent off for striking a team-mate, 10-man Everton beat Manchester United to earn David Moyes his first Premier League win as a visiting manager to Old Trafford.

title: Gueye sent off for striking team-mate - but Moyes 'quite likes' it
description: Everton's Idrissa Gueye is sent off for striking team-mate Michael Keane during their Premier League victory at Manchester United.

title: Eze hits hat-trick as Arsenal thrash Tottenham
description: Eberechi Eze scores a hat-trick to help Arsenal thump rivals Tottenham 4-1 and go six points clear at the top of the Premier League - despite a moment of magic from Richarlison.

title: Who are Premier League kings of the long throw?
description: Last season 20 goals were scored through throw-in routines in the Premier League. We are only 11 rounds into the 2025-26 campaign and have had 12 goals already from such routines.

title: 'I haven't got a magic wand' - Edwards faces impossible job at Wolves
description: New Wolves boss Rob Edwards shown the scale of club's challenge to stay in Premier League following 2-0 home defeat by Crystal Palace.

title: Brighton come from behind to beat Brentford
description: Jack Hinshelwood scores on his return from injury to help Brighton come from behind to beat Brentford 2-1 in the Premier League.

title: Fulham beat Sunderland with late Jimenez winner
description: Raul Jimenez scores a late winner to give Fulham a well-deserved win over Sunderland in the Premier League at Craven Cottage.

title: Palace into top four as Edwards loses first game as Wolves boss
description: Crystal Palace comfortably beat Wolverhampton Wanderers to move into fourth in the Premier League and condemn Rob Edwards to a defeat in his first game in charge at Wolves.

title: Barnes fires Newcastle to victory against Man City
description: Harvey Barnes scores twice as Newcastle put a dent in Manchester City's title charge and grab three points in the Premier League at St James' Park.

title: Forest inflict stunning defeat on Liverpool at Anfield
description: Goals by Murillo, Nicolo Savona and Morgan Gibbs-White condemn Liverpool to their sixth defeat in seven Premier League games as Nottingham Forest put on a brilliant display to win 3-0 at Anfield.

title: All your FPL stats and Premier League team news in one place
description: Every key bit of Premier League team news and the most important Fantasy Premier League statistics - all in one place.

title: 'Newcastle require Premier League reboot amid curious season'
description: Newcastle United are going well in the Champions League and Carabao Cup but are two points above the relegation zone before in-form Manchester City visit Tyneside on Saturday.

title: Sutton's predictions v singer Olly Murs
description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on singer Olly Murs - and AI - with his predictions for this weekend's Premier League fixtures.

title: Premier League clubs to be banned from selling assets to themselves
description: Clubs will no longer be able to sell assets like hotels and women's teams to themselves from next season as the Premier League moves to a new system of financial fair play.
